title: Cervin Guyomar Homepage
text:
About me




 I am a reasearch engineer in INRAE GenPhySE in Toulouse, France. I’m a member of the DynaGen group and the Sigenae platform.
I am a bioinformatician, with a focus on sequencing data analysis for functional genomics

title: Cervin Guyomar Homepage
text:
Research
Here is a summary of my past and current projects :

Functional annotation of animal genomes
I’m invovled in two europeans projects aiming at improving genomic annotations of farmed species. I am a contributor of the WP2 of GENE-SWitCH, where we analyze multi-omics (RNA-seq, smRNA-seq, ChIP-seq, ATAC-seq, Hi-C) data of two monogastric species during development to improve functional annotations of their genomes and characterize the regulation landscape during development.
I am also more lightly involved in AQUA-FAANG, for the annotation of miRNAs in 6 fish species.


Genotyping using low coverage sequencing data
I’m exploring the capacities of sparse or low coverage sequencing for cost efficient genome-wide genotyping. I have started to developp PARSEC a Nextflow pipeline for variant calling and imputation using such data


Bioinformatics analyses
As a Sigenae engineer, I bring support to biologists to process genomic data, in particular RNA-seq and smRNA-seq data.


Past projects :

Annotation and analysis of circulating miRNAs of the rainbow trout for biomarker selection
PhD project :

Targetted genome assembly in metagenomic data (MinYS)
Strain level characterization of microbial species in the pea aphid holobiont

title: Publications
text:
Peer reviewed publications

Yeast extract improves growth in rainbow trout (Oncorhynchus mykiss) fed a fishmeal-free diet and modulates the hepatic and distal intestine transcriptomic profile  L. Frohn, D. Peixoto, C. Guyomar, C. Teixeira, F. Terrier, P. Aguirre, S. Maman Haddad, J. Bobe, B. Costas, N. Richard, K. Pinel, S. Skiba-Cassy  Aquaculture, 2024
Looking for a needle in a haystack: de novo phenotypic target identification reveals Hippo pathway-mediated miR-202 regulation of egg production  S. Janati-Idrissi, M. Roza de Abreu, C. Guyomar, F. de Mello, T. Nguyen, N. Mechkouri, S. Gay, J. Montfort, A.A. Gonzalez, M. Abbasi, J. Bugeon, V. Thermes, H. Seitz, J. Bobe  Nucleic Acid Research, 2023
TAGADA: a scalable pipeline to improve genome annotations with RNA-seq data   C. Kurylo, C. Guyomar, S. Foissac, S. Djebali  NAR Genomics and Bioinformatics, 2023
**[A high‐quality functional genome assembly of Delia radicum L. (Diptera: Anthomyiidae) annotated from egg to adult]
MinYS: Mine Your Symbiont by targeted genome assembly in symbiotic communities  C. Guyomar, W. Delage, F. Legeai, C. Mougel, JC. Simon and C. Lemaitre  NAR Genomics and Bioinformatics, 2020
Multi-scale characterization of symbiont diversity in the pea aphid complex through metagenomic approaches.  C. Guyomar, F. Legeai, E. Jousselin, C. Mougel, C. Lemaitre and JC. Simon  Microbiome, 2018
Phylogenetic distribution, biogeography and the effects of land management upon bacterial non-specific acid phosphatase gene diversity and abundance.  A. Neal Andrew, M. Blackwell, E. Akkari, C. Guyomar, I. Clark, P. Hirsch, 2017.  Plant and Soil 2017
Land-use influences phosphatase gene microdiversity in soils.  A. Neal Andrew, M. Rossmann, C. Brearley, E. Akkari, C. Guyomar, I. Clark, E. Allen, P. Hirsch, 2017.  Environmental Microbiology 2017



Pre-prints

Maternal auts2a contribution is a major intergenerational driver of neurodevelopment and behavior   A Clément, C Merdrignac, A Brionne, T Nguyen, J. Montfort, C. Guyomar, A. Dauvé, A. Herpin, V. Colson, J. Bobe



Oral communications

Journées SeqBIM, Marne-la-Vallée, 12/2019  MinYS: Mine Your Symbiont by targeted genome assembly in symbiotic communities.
JOBIM, Nantes, 07/2019  MinYS: Mine Your Symbiont by targeted genome assembly in symbiotic communities.
International conference on holobionts, Paris, 20/04/2017  Multi-scale characterization of symbiont diversity in the pea aphid complex through metagenomic approaches
Insect symbioaia workshop, Sde Boker, Israel, 05/2017  Multi-scale characterization of symbiont diversity in the pea aphid complex through metagenomic approaches
Journées BioGenOuest, Rennes, 14/12/2016 Aphid microbiota, from field ecology to metagenomics 



Posters

C. Guyomar, W. Delage, F. Legeai, C. Mougel, JC. Simon, C. Lemaitre. : Reference guided genome assembly in metagenomic samples ; RECOMB 2018, Paris
C. Guyomar, F. Legeai, C. Lemaitre, JC. Simon. : Multi-scale characterization of symbiont diversity in the pea aphid complex through metagenomic approaches, JOBIM 2017, Lille

title: Cervin Guyomar
text:
Teaching

Statistical learnings
2017-2018 - Master 1, UFR SVE, Université Rennes 1  Statistical modelling and initiation to machine learning
Simulation for biostatistics
2016 - Master 1 Santé publique  Initiation to R programming, random variable simulations, stochastic simulation  Slides (in french)



Supervising

Wesley Delage (2017)
Master 2 Bioinformatique et génomique, Rennes Development of an innovative method based on a reference guided assembly for the genome reconstruction of a bacteriophage APSE



Scientific dissemination

Une petite histoire de symbiose(s)

Festival Sciences en Court[s] (3rd price)
Festival BioInfuse




Organization

Volunteer at RECOMB 2018

title: Cervin Guyomar Homepage
text:

Here is a summary of my past and current projects :
